Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight's computer chimes]

Quote.Speaker: New Instant Message
Quote.Text: Stone & Son Suit Warehouse contract expired with their paper provider! Go get it! -David Wallace

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stone and Son Suit Warehouse recently lost their paper provider. They're a family owned business [chuckles]. Jim and I used to clean up at those. We'd go in pretending to be family - brothers. We did it at a family owned law firm, at a family owned construction company, and a family owned motorcycle store. Jim and Dwight Shrupert. I was the dynamic, likeable winner that was doted upon by Mom. And Jim was the closeted foot fetishist pretending to belong. The client never knew any of that, but I knew.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone with Jim] I hope you've been paying your wig storage bills Jimbo, because it's time for another episode of "Handsome and Stinky, paper brothers for hire".

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, Stinky, can't do it. Too busy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, god, this again? You're Stinky.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. There's no possible way I can get there, so just ask Phyllis. She can be your older sister or something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis, my sister? More like my dead great great grandmother who died of stupidity.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have ears, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, do you really have ears, Phyllis? Like all human beings? We all have ears. [back to Jim] See what you leave me with here, Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, I'm in Philadelphia right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How is that my problem? Get in your car and drive down here. You can make it in 30 minutes if you drive 240 miles per hour.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Huh. How long would it take me if I drove 300 miles an hour?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm. That's a good... question. 300 times... [Jim hangs up] 180... Um that comes to 25 minutes. [realizes Jim hung up] Yes. Oh, well, thank you Jim. Yes, I am better than you. Thanks for acknowledging that. Okay, bye bye. Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Darryl, looking good!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Heading to Philly. Interview with Jim's company.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, good luck. When you get to Philly, will you tell Jim I miss him?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Why don't you come along and tell him yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ha ha. That'd be great. Kind of like ditching school, except instead of getting suspended, you get... What do you get? Oh my god! Why didn't I think of this? Andy's not here. Oh, hey, Erin, um, I'm expecting a shipment of pens. Can you cover that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Mhm. Cover that. What does that mean, exactly? What are we talking here? Details.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A delivery guy will deliver a box of pens, and you just make sure everything's in order.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What? Everything? What, how do I make sure it's in order? I [laughs] haven't been trained for this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [giggles] Okay, see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey guys.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Clark!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, look who's back, Dwight Junior.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, so how was it? I mean... the sex with Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: A gentleman doesn't discuss such matters. Especially when the feelings of a lady are involved.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Women reach their sexual peak at whatever age Jan was last week. I mean it was... like making love with a wild animal. But not like a cougar like you might think. It was uh... like a swarm of bees. Bees that just find something wrong with every hotel room.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nothing wrong with being a gentleman. Like my mom used to say, "Talk classy, act nasty".

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: What's with the wig Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What, is it on backwards? [partially removes wig, revealing her bald head]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Nope, you got it. You fixed it. Uh, I have a gift from Jan. It's an espresso maker! We came to be quite fond of espresso on the Amalfi Coast so... bon appetite.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ooo! 16 types of espresso! Now that's Italian.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My friend has one of these. Fool-proof espresso every time.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Always with the friends Oscar. Can't we just enjoy the new espresso machine?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Actually, it's pronounced "espresso"... Wait. That's what you said. I apologize, I just assumed you would mispronounce it. So...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There he is! [chuckles] We are all so proud of you for the small part that you played in landing the white pages. Prouder of me, but...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: If you really want to show appreciation, just give me half the commission.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gosh, you know, I wish I could but, uh... No. Hey, listen, remember how everyone used to call you Dwight Junior and how much you loved that?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [sarcastically chuckling] I loved it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How would you like to pretend to by my son in order to land a sale?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: If it'll lead to me being a salesman, I'll pretend to be your friend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then looks like we have a deal... Son [holds up a suit identical to his]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi guys!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey, look who it is!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Sorry. Super-busy. Pens coming in later, just grabbing a Java before all hell breaks loose.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Try this one. [handing Erin a cup of espresso]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Thank you! [leaves the room]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't really have time to think about Pete right now. I just have a lot going on with this whole shipment of pens. And I have a lot of people trusting me, and I would feel super guilty if I broke anyone's trust. About the pens.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You ready for your interview?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I was born ready! No, I suck at interviews. I had Andy's job in the bag until my interview.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you shouldn't be nervous about this. This is a tiny start-up with a bunch of guys just as dorky as Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really, you can't be scared of a room full of Jims. I love the guy, but he's basically Gumby with hair. [Darryl laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: [chuckling] It's kind of funny, a father and son sales team meeting with a father and son suit store.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, you're right! We hadn't even thought of that, had we boy? [to Clark]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No, we sure hadn't Pop. [both chuckling]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Takes picture from desk] Oh! You're a hunter I see. Spend your early mornings out in the blinds, like Clarky and me. Huh? [grabs Clark's shoulder]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: He calls me Clarky 'cause he's my Dad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Guilty!

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: You don't meet many hunters these days.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: My dad is the best hunter there is. I mean, he's like a serial killer... of animals. One time, he snuck up behind a sleeping deer and just sawed its head right of. It was sick! [Dwight imitates sawing and blood spurting out of his neck, then makes a dying noise]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was his birthday, just turned three. So...

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Ahh...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You guys, I kind of think I want to try them all. Is that crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No. Look, without a taste test, how are we supposed to know which flavors we like to reorder?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Taste test? I'm in!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: YOLO! [singing and dancing]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What? [everyone is confused]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's a thing. It means "you only live once".

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, we're aware of what it means Oscar, you just do not look cool saying it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Alright everybody, who's in? [everyone except Angela puts their hand in the middle of the group, like a huddle] Angela? [Angela shakes her head] Don't make us come over there.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, I don't... no.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Alright, let's go. [starts shuffling the whole group towards Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can't I just agree without putting my hand in?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Absolutely not!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, fine. [puts a napkin on top of everyone else's hands and reluctantly puts her own hand on the napkin]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ok guys, "we all drink them all".

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [Meredith, Phyllis, Nellie, Angela, Creed, Oscar, Stanley] We all drink them all!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, where's my ring?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm sure it'll turn up.

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: [in the background] Yes ma'am, you want to go east on Franklin, take that all the way to Commonweath. You'll see us on the right side, you can't miss us.

Quote.Speaker: Dennis
Quote.Text: ...And I want to reach every demographic possible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I hear what you're saying, and we will. The thing is, we gotta lock down this key demographic first. The rest will come, I promise. Just give me a couple weeks, alright?

Quote.Speaker: Dennis
Quote.Text: We're talking weeks here, not months, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Weeks. Always weeks. Man, the last time I talked months was like, a million weeks ago.

Quote.Speaker: Dennis
Quote.Text: Alright. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks Dennis, I appreciate it. [To Pam] Hey! How are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just wanted to see you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's so great!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Damn! Jim, you got a real Facebook energy going on here man. You Zuckerberged this place out!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's pretty great, right? I mean, we're coming along... [to coworker] Hey, Wade, we gotta just push up Dennis's timeline

Quote.Speaker: Wade
Quote.Text: Okay

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [back to Pam] Actually, you know what? Give me one second, okay? Make yourselves at home.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...But I think that all of your concerns will be answered when you see the brochure that Clark's getting out of my car. He's a good boy, does whatever I say.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: [sighs] I can't relate to that, my son hates my guts.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh... really.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Bring him into the business, and he resents me. How do you like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [fumbling] Well, things between me and Clark are good, but not great. In fact, I will say that they're not even good. Really, they're bad. Like you and your son.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [enters] Here you go, Pop! I know it was just a couple minutes, but... God I missed you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What took you so long? Were you loitering out there like a hooligan, smoking a doobie?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [confused] I sure was. Just like he taught me, looking cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're being disrespectful!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: ...And I love you, for saying that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispers to Clark] We don't get along.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [catches on] Ha ha! I just burned him. Because the truth is... our relationship is... terr-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Terrible!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Genius. Stupid, stupid genius!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, this place is... so great. I had no idea - on the phone, you made it sound kind of dinky.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I mean, I don't even have the paycheck yet. It is a startup, so... These things go down all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: If this company's going down, I wanna go down on it. With it. I wanna go down with it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Are you cool to just hang out?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, no problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah? [to Darryl] You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The pen delivery went amazing, and now I've got all these pens just waiting to be unpacked. But Pam did not tell me to unpack the pens, and I'm not one of those people who's just like, "Uh, sure. I'll accept the pens when they come in, and then as soon as your back's turned, I unpack the pens and get all this credit as some great pen unpacker. On the other hand... they are just sitting here. Pam didn't tell me not to unpack them. Don't want to be a busybody, but I don't want to be a lazybones. Busybody, lazybones. Busybody, lazybones. Ahh! My brain is ping-ponging around in my head right now, it's insane! I'm sorry, what was your question again? Oh yeah, no. I've never had an espresso before. They're good though.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: A-bam! [slams espresso cup on table] My favorite is Viennese Amaretto. And the worst flavor I've tried so far is Alpine Select!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes! [giggles and picks up Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: One! [as he picks Angela up in the air]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin! Kevin! Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Two... [picks Angela up again]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Three...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's enough Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Four!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's enough!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So for your menswear catalogue, I think we can offer you some very competitive pricing.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: I heard that before...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, I understand, but -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I bet you have. He knows nothing about what people have heard before, my son.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Here we go again, another lecture from the old man.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Listen to him. He created you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe if you listened a little bit, you'd improve. No wonder women despise you.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Women don't despise me...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: His last girlfriend was a transvestite. I knew it right away. Adam's apple like the prow of a ship, thumbs like a lowland gorilla. Ha, but this one couldn't see it, or didn't wanna see it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Alright, that's enough, 'cause I can say some things about him too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah? Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Like the time that you got drunk and, and then... Killed those kids on their way to prom!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That never happened. He's always been a liar. Ever since he was a little kid. He got caught "saving treats" from the kitty litter box.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Really shameful...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So we can offer you matte or glossy printing-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Glistening brown morsels tumbling from every pouch in his trousers.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: There's obviously a volume discount uh, if you-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Following the cat around on his knees with his hands cupped beneath its tail, going "please kitty, may I have some more?" You can't make this stuff up!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No, I think someone could make it up. Someone with very few friends.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: Hey fellas, sorry to keep you waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Here he is, my son.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Got cat turd collector written all over him.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: ...Did you say cat turd collector?

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: ...So definitely looking to expand our market, but for now we're just concentrating on athletes that are popular here in the northeast. Of course, that's not a mandate.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: "Mandate"- Always think of two men on a date. [awkward moment] I have gay friends... I have one gay friend. [to Jim] Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hm

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: Alright, so what makes you think you'd be a good fit here?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [freezes] Ummm... [a moment later] Alright. Obviously y'all look really busy, and uh, I don't want to waste your time anymore. Sorry, I just uhh... Obviously I'm not qualified to be here man, I'm... I'm a warehouse manager, you know...

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: Darryl, I was a newspaper editor.

Quote.Speaker: Female Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: Science teacher, volleyball coach.

Quote.Speaker: 3rd Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: I work at a home shopping network.

Quote.Speaker: 4th Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: I'm a laywer. I'm the only one here who can honestly help. [group chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And as you know, I was a paper salesman. [whispers to Darryl] Hey, I find it helps if you just picture everybody naked. [group overhears and chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool. Hey, thanks...

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: So how about we start over, hmm? Darryl, do you have any thoughts on the company?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes, as a matter of fact, I uh... [pulls booklets from his bag] I wrote some down. There you go. [passes out booklets] Wow, this guy came prepared, it impresses me! [group laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Ah! So, this is what 2:00 P.M. looks like around here!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I usually take a siesta about now.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [to Erin] Stocking pens, huh? You're like the new office administrator.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, I just took over the pen shipment because Pam had to leave. When I say it out loud, I know that sounds insane, but it's the truth, I swear.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam! Pam, look out! Erin's gunning for your job!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, I'm not! [Kevin imitates gunfire] It's not like that at all! Forget it, I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam, look out!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pens, you did not buy into this. I am sorry, what a day you've had.

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: By the way, Jim talks about you all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's sweet that he talks about me.

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: It's too bad he still hast to work part time in Scranton though...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, that's funny because I think of him as working part time in Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: We can't wait until you move here.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, you guys are here to sell us paper?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you mind? The men are talking.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: Sons used to idolize their fathers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Us old timers need to stick together. And how better than by signing a contract?

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Father
Quote.Text: I'd love to! Sam Junior here, he runs the business now. Kind of pushed me out, truth be told. I'm just here for human contract.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: Okay Pop...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, so you're the boss?

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Clark.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Let's talk.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So if you look at our catalog here...

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: Well, thanks for coming down Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Female Athlead Employee
Quote.Text: It was nice meeting you Darryl, I think you'd fit in great here.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah me too. I think it'd be like... You know what? [grabs basketball] I think it'd be like a Kevin Durant jump shot... Perfecto! [shoots basketball at hoop on wall, basketball misses and lands in fish tank, killing the fish] Oh my god...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're the ones who put a fish tank next to a basketball hoop. It's like if I put a glass of milk on the edge of the table and Cece knocks it over, I don't blame Cece.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So I'm like a three year old girl in this scenario...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Say they don't hire you. It's not like you're out on the street. You have a great job with people who love you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And I'd only get to see Jada on the weekends. You know, I'm... I'm not so sure I'd like living in Philadelphia.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Right? Thank you! It's just Philly. Everyone's acting like it's New York or Paris or London.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who needs it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [enters] Okay, so the consensus was that that was unique. They're going to make you pay for the fish, and... they wanted to know when you can start.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? [Jim shrugs] How about yesterday?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I guess you gotta move to Philly after all.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes, I love Philly! Two-One-Five or die!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I'm not upset. I'm really excited for Darryl... Maybe I'm a little disappointed that we'll be losing him.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It feels really hot in here. Is it hot in here? It feels really really hot in here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's insane! They need to have the A.C. on year round! January too!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [banging on window] I don't get the point of this stupid window!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I mean, look, you and I both know that in paper or fashion, styles change. Check out my dad's suit. You are looking at pure acrylic. That's why his face always breaks out.

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: Does that suit come with a fire extinguisher? [Clark chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You know what Dad? Maybe you should buy me a suit. I mean, I'm going to need one right? If I'm ever going to get a "real job" and move my "lazy ass" out of your "G.D. house".

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: He's got you there...

Quote.Speaker: Suit Store Son
Quote.Text: [to Clark in dressing room] That's Italian silk. Very comfortable. Very tasteful... Although expensive.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, you don't want Italian. You'll look like a mafia don. Next thing you know, you'll be doing life in Rikers Island.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Well, that's better than looking like the undertaker from boring island.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That place doesn't exist. It's not a documented island. Ha ha, cartograph much?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [emerges from dressing room wearing a sharp black suit] How do I look?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually... You look great. They steered you right. I guess it does make sense buying from a father son team. You know what? I'll take one too.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Everyone! Now that we have all this energy, why don't we move the copier into the annex like we've always wanted to?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Frickin' A!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So long, noise!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: One, two, three! [all gather around copier and push, tearing carpet beneath]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And we have torn up the carpet! Oh, we're going to be in so much trouble!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wait! [looking at the hardwood floor beneath the carpet] It's beautiful. Hardwood! I always knew it was down here, I just never dreamed that I would actually see it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Tear up the carpet!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Kill their fish, and they still hire me. That's how you do that, baby. It's all good, I'm ready. Y'all ready for this? [sings intro to "Everybody dance now", points to Pam to sing first line]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [reluctantly] Everybody dance now... [Darryl continues singing]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin, move. I can't pull up the rug if you're standing on it with your rhinoceros feet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well I can't stand here if you pull the carpet out from under me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, my head is killing me. Does anyone have a baby asprin?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, enough with the whining already! Why don't you just have some more coffee?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's all gone. I didn't get a chance to try them all because Creed poured my Bogota Sunrise in the plant.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I saw the leaves twitch!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You shut up!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Everybody shut up and work!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We don't work for you!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hey, it's five o'clock. [everyone leaves and a traffic backup occurs in the parking lot]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [with horns honking] Kevin, can-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! We did it! [leaving the suit store]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You opened the door-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you closed it. The boys are back in town. [high fives Clark] High fives! Ha ha!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, so all that really specific cat turd business, that was about you, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You got me! [tickles Clark and chuckles] I used to collect them!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Each one is very different, like a snowflake.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [shocked after seeing the torn up carpet] Hey... What happened here?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You left me in charge of the pens, Pam. That's what happened. The pens happened.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...Are the pens here?
